newsitem.title: USA: U.S West Coast crude prices rise, market idle.
newsitem.headline: U.S West Coast crude prices rise, market idle.

text.p: U.S. West Coast light crude prices edged up with other markets on Friday, but local differentials for Alaskan crude held steady in a idle pre-weekend session, traders said.
Spot barrels of West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude gained a slight six cents a barrel on Friday, supported by strength in the gasoline futures market in New York.
September deliveries of unleaded gasoline rose 0.48 cents a gallon on Friday to 66.81 cents.
The spot price of Alaska North Slope crude remained at $1.97 a barrel under WTI.
The discount, which has shrunk since a mid-June cargo sold at minus $2.08, is expected to hold steady for the rest of the month with majors buyers supplied for the month.
Kern River and Wilmington grades were flat Friday after rising with postings the day before.
